certificate.label: Apple Pay Certificate Filename
certificate.comment: This is the location of the certificate file provided by Apple, relative to the /etc directory. For example, if the file's name is server.pem, this value should be server.pem, and the file should reside as <server root>/etc/server.pem. This file should contain both a certificate and a private key.

domain_name.label: Website Domain Name
domain_name.comment: The local domain name for this website.

store_name.label: Store Name
store_name.comment: The name of the store to display on the Apple Pay card

capabilities.label: Additional Merchant Capabilities
capabilities.comment: This setting provides allows the merchant to specify which capabilities they support. 'supports3DS' is a required capability for using Apple Pay and cannot be configured.

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.comment: Enabling this functionality also requires enabling the core Cybersource device fingerprinting functionality

use_internal_block.label: Use Internal Rejection Mechanism
use_internal_block.comment: You may disable this if you intend to customize the rejection workflow. Leave enabled if you are not doing this or you are unsure.

action_on_error.label: Action on Error
action_on_error.comment: Specify the default action if an error occurs.

title.label: Rejection Message Title
title.comment: Customize the title for the message on the rejection page.

allow_simulator.label: Allow Simulator
allow_simulator.comment: Allows you to make payments using the Apple Simulator. Note, however, that this method does not make an API call back to Cybersource. It will log data as if the API was called, but since payment data is not provided in the simulator it will not make the final call. In addition, this setting is only honored if "Payment Methods / Cybersource Secure Acceptance (Sop) / Test mode" is turned on.

tax_countries.label: Customer countries to calculate Tax on

tax_shipping_code.label: Taxable Shipping Product Code
tax_shipping_code.comment: To set the product code you need to go to the menu item "Sales / Tax / Product Tax Classes" and create or modify a tax class with your Cybersource product code for shipping items. Next, match "Tax Class forS Shipping" under the "Tax Classes" menu on this page.
